âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it!

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because I find it fun to solve in a few minutes.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: The problem is simple and the instructions are clear.
I like this problem, branching based on argument presence is alway a nice touch.

Please put some punctuations (.,;?!) in the statement as well as markup (<<bold>>, [[var]], {{const}}, ```monospace```) so it is easier to read and understand for clashers.

Please also add constraints ie it is always possible to find a a solution or min/max values for given dimensions.

Input section
* Please change N to [[N]].

Output section
* As I commented earlier, the presentation should follow the contribution guidelines, e.g. just this line without the example output:
<<[[N]] lines:>> An integer in each line for the area of each rectangle/square

Thanks.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
I like the idea behind the puzzle. Although it takes me several times to fully understand what was the inputs of the problem.
Nice puzzle. Maybe somehow highlight the fact that for a rectangle you are given a perimeter and a side, not two sides.

I liked the idea. The instructions are not clear though. It took me time to understand what I get as input whether it's a square or rectangle, especially the definition of the input of rectangle "x and y" when it should b "p and x" (for parameter and length), and what I need to output for each shape (that I need to calculate the area of each shape in the list).
fun to resolve but you should rewrite the input section for "Next N lines" because it's actually really confusing.

Input and Output sections
* Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines to present these two sections, e.g. formatting line numbers in bold, including variable types, and formatting the variable names.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
* Please remove the examples.

Constraint section
* You may remove the constraint after you have stated the variable type as integer in the above sections.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
Thanks for your feedback ðŸ˜€ I have updated the description to make it clear.
